fractal

Class RenderManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • fractal.RenderManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class RenderManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Manages all the layers that make up a fractal. It could, in many ways, be thought of as a fractal itself.
    Author:
    Calvin
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RenderManager()
      Initializes a fractal with a black to white palette centered at tbe point 0,0.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RenderManager

        public RenderManager()
        Initializes a fractal with a black to white palette centered at tbe point 0,0. It has a zoom level of .25 and a single HistogramLayer

      • RenderManager

        public RenderManager(Parameters params)
        Initializes a fractal with the given parameters
        Parameters:
        params - the parameters of the fractal to be initialized

      • RenderManager

        public RenderManager(java.lang.String name)
        Initializes a fractal from a file. This name points to a saved fractal.
        Parameters:
        name - of a saved fractal

      • RenderManager

        public RenderManager(java.io.File f)
        Initializes a fractal from a .fractal file
        Parameters:
        f - a .fractal file

    • Method Detail

      • render

        public void render(int[][] pixels)
        Renders the fractal using the given 2D array of pixels.
        Parameters:
        pixels - the pixels the fractal will be drawn to.

      • render

        public int[][] render()
        used to get a 2D array of pixels representing the image rendered by the layers
        Returns:
        a 2D array representing the rendered image of the fractal

      • render

        public void render(java.lang.String filePath,
                   java.lang.String title)
        Renders the fractal and saves it as an png at the designated filepath and with the designated title
        Parameters:
        filePath - the filePath pointing to the directory of the png
        title - the title of the png

                              boolean visible)
        Used to change the visibility of any layer
        Parameters:

      • renderMovie

        public void renderMovie(java.lang.String filePath,
                        double zoomSpeed,
                        java.lang.String title)
        Makes a deep zoom of the fractal until the program is stopped
        Parameters:
        filePath - the directory where the rendered images will be saved
        zoomSpeed - the speed at which the fractal zooms in
        title - the title of the rendered fractal

      • renderImage

        public static void renderImage(java.lang.String filePath,
                               java.lang.String title,
                               java.awt.image.BufferedImage img)
        A static method created to save a BufferedImage as a png to a specified location
        Parameters:
        filePath - the directory where the image will be saved
        title - the title of the saved png
        img - the image to be saved as a png

      • setPixels

        public static void setPixels(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img,
                             int[][] pixels)
        Sets the pixels of the BufferedImage to those of the 2D array of color data. Assumes they are the same size.
        Parameters:
        img - the image whose color data will be set
        pixels - the color data used to set the BufferedImage

      • setLocation

        public void setLocation(Point location)
        Used to change the location on the Mandelbrot set that the fractal renders
        Parameters:
        location - the new location on the Mandelbrot set

      • getVisibility

        public boolean getVisibility(int index)
        Returns whether or not a certain layer is visible
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the layer in question
        Returns:
        whether or not the layer is visible

      • getOpacity

        public double getOpacity(int index)
        Used to get the opacity of a layer at a specific index
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the layer in question
        Returns:
        the opacity of the layer in question

      • setZoom

        public void setZoom(double zoom)
        Sets the zoom value of the fractal and takes care of any stretching issues of the layer so that the fractal is never streched, regardless of the dimension of the image being drawn. It does based on the value of the longest edge.
        Parameters:
        zoom - the new zoom level of the fractal

      • getPalette

        public Palette getPalette(int layer)
        used to get the palette of a certain layer
        Parameters:
        layer - the layer number of the layer in question. this number ranges from 1 to infinity
        Returns:
        the palette used by the layer at index layer - 1

      • getScreenResolution

        public java.awt.Dimension getScreenResolution()
        used to get the resolution the fractal renders at
        Returns:
        a dimension containing the fractal resolution

      • getRealResolution

        public Point getRealResolution()
        used to get the dimension of the fractal in real coordinates
        Returns:
        the dimensions of the fractal in read coordinates. the x value represents the width and the y value represents the height

      • setScreenResolution

        public void setScreenResolution(java.awt.Dimension screenResolution)
        used to set the resolution the fractal renders at
        Parameters:
        screenResolution - the new resolution the fractal will render at
